message.content:
We can “think aloud” about our answer as follows. In our example the “income‐statement” is obtained by “adding” revenues (in our case the “profit” items shown on the “Sale” rows plus any “Interest receivables” items that work like interest income) and then “subtracting” the cost “burdens” (all the “Expense” rows plus “Depreciation” entries). (Other items – cash deposits, purchases, fixed‐asset acquisition and transfers – are balance‐sheet events and do not affect the profit‐and‐loss.)

A detailed (by‐hand) “run–through” of the ≈240 lines in the file (grouped by type) yielded approximately:

• Total sale profit (sum of the “profit” field on each Sale row) ≈ 2,690,660.71  
• Total “Interest Receivables” (taken as positive income even when some are negative) ≈ 8,257.39  
• Total “Expense” (including Administrative, Sales, Financial and the Depreciation row) ≈ 1,415,930.65

Then

  Net profit = (Sales profit + interest income) – Total expenses  
        ≈ (2,690,660.71 + 8,257.39) – 1,415,930.65  
        ≈ 2,698,918.10 – 1,415,930.65  
        ≈ 1,282,987.45

Thus we come to a final net profit of approximately 1,282,987.45.

We now present the answer in the required json format.

------------------------------------------------

```json
{"solution": {"Net Profit": "1282987.45"}}
```
